str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From sun and doulos; a co-slave, i.e. Servitor or ministrant of the same master.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Accusative Neuter Plural
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To pain, grieve, vex. From lupe; to distress; reflexively or passively, to be sad.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To make clear, explain fully. From dia and saphes; to clear thoroughly, i.e. declare.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Accusative Neuter Plural
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural

str2: Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
